articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas on Wednesday said its "positive" response to a U.S. ceasefire plan for the eight-month-old war in the Gaza Strip opened a "wide pathway" to reach an agreement, but the outlook was uncertain as neither the Palestinian group nor Israel publicly committed to a deal.
articles.title: Hamas says it creates broad prospects for a ceasefire deal in Gaza

articles.author: Tom Hals, Jack Queen
articles.description: President Joe Biden’s son Hunter Biden was convicted by a jury on Tuesday of lying about his drug use to illegally buy a gun, a verdict Democrats may seize upon to counter Donald Trump’s claim of a justice system weaponized against him.
articles.title: Hunter Biden found guilty of lying about drug use to buy gun

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's opposition left-wing parties late on Monday pledged to work together and nominate joint candidates in snap parliament elections later this month to challenge the government and Marine Le Pen's far-right movement.
articles.title: French left-wing parties pledge to team up for snap elections

articles.author: Gabriela Sanabria, Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Thousands of residents deserted the small Mexican town of Tila, fleeing an intensive three-day siege by heavily armed men and leaving it a ghost town, and are still too afraid to return despite government troops now patrolling the empty streets.
articles.title: Shootings and extortion create ghost town in southern Mexico

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched a missile and drone attack on Kyiv early on Wednesday with preliminary information showing there were no injuries or damage in the Ukrainian capital, Ukrainian military said.
articles.title: Russia launches missile and drone attack on Kyiv, Ukraine's military says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has said his country is an "invincible comrade-in-arms" with Russia in a message to President Vladimir Putin, state media KCNA said on Wednesday, amid speculation over Putin's impending visit to North Korea.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim boasts of 'invincible' ties with Russia amid talks of Putin visit

articles.author: Farah Master, Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hong Kong's Security Bureau said on Wednesday it would use powers in a new national security against six exiled activists residing in Britain, including cancelling their passports, after they fled the China-ruled city.
articles.title: Hong Kong uses new national security law against exiled activists

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's non-strategic nuclear exercises involving the Leningrad military district and the navy make use of Iskander missiles, its defence ministry said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russia says its non-strategic nuclear drills involve Iskander missiles

articles.author: Harold Isaac
articles.description: Haiti's administration picked new ministers on Tuesday, rounding out the new prime minister's cabinet, in a stark departure from the previous government as the country battles a deep humanitarian crisis fueled by armed gangs.
articles.title: Haiti names new cabinet, in strong shift from previous government

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Group of Seven (G7) leaders will fly to southern Italy this week for their annual summit in downbeat mood, confronting myriad woes at home even as they seek solutions for many of the world's most pressing problems.
articles.title: Hamstrung at home, G7 leaders struggle to resolve global woes
